Option (b) is a more specific version of option (a). It includes the survival of all passengers and crew, but also adds the detail that they celebrated together later that evening.

The conjunction fallacy is a cognitive bias where people assume that specific conditions are more probable than general ones. In reality, the probability of two events happening together (a conjunction) is always less than or equal to the probability of either one of them happening alone.

Which is more likely?
(a) 
Florida has 650,000 Jews, many of them Democrats 
(b) 
Florida has 650,000 Jews, many of them Democrats to be hesitant in supporting Obama due to his policies.
87.target_answer: (a) Florida has 650,000 Jews, many of them Democrats
87.init_model_answer:
The correct answer is (a) "Florida has 650,000 Jews, many of them Democrats".

This is because option (a) is a simple, broad statement about the demographic composition of Florida. It does not make any specific claims about the behaviors or attitudes of individuals within that demographic group.

Option (b), on the other hand, is an example of the conjunction fallacy. It adds a specific condition ("hesitant in supporting Obama due to his policies") to the statement in option (a), making it less likely overall. The conjunction fallacy occurs when people assume that specific conditions are more likely to occur than general ones. In reality, the more conditions you add to a statement, the less likely it is to be true.
